TopicTitle: [Answered] How do I know if the game is paused from a PartModule

Articles.Content:
Writing my first C# app and have created a part that Beeps when some part of the Rocket is over a threshold % of

maxTemp.

how do I know the game is paused to stop the beeping?

I have found FlightDriver.Pause checking it from inside OnUpdate does not seem to work.

any help would be appreciated

Edited April 29, 2015 by Skavin

I think you should override the FixedUpdate Method and only beep as long as it is called. THis Method should not be called durring pause.

Edited April 29, 2015 by FreeThinker

You can hook into the pause events like this:


GameEvents.onGamePause.Add(new EventVoid.OnEvent(this.MyOnPause));

So code that you put in your MyOnPause() method in that class will get run when the game is paused.

HTH
